l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: s goes to /s/; o goes to /o/; b goes to /b/; r goes to /ɾ/; e goes to /e/
c goes to /k/; n goes to /n/
f goes to /f/; m goes to /m/

l a: k i l o m e t̪ ɾ o s
l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: k goes to /k/; t goes to /t̪/
accented vowels are pronounced the same as their non-accented counterparts

l a: t̪ a m b i e n

l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: g goes to /ɡ/; u goes to /u/

l a: θ i u d̪ a d̪
l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: c goes to /θ/ before front vowels
gu goes to /ɡ/ before a front vowel; rr goes to /r/

l a: l i n ɡ w i s t̪ i k a

l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: v goes to /b/; z goes to /θ/

l a: e k s i s t̪ e
m e x i k o
l goes to /l/; a goes to /a/: some words preserve the older orthography in which x goes to /x/; these are given in the rules

l a: m e x i k o
m e x i k a n o
m e x i k a n o s
m e x i k a n a
m e x i k a n a s
x a b i e ɾ
o a x a k a
a x a ɾ k i a
x i m e n a
x i m e n e θ
x i t̪ a n o
s i l o f o n o
